channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Financial crimes watchdog removes Turkey from money laundering 'gray list'
item.description: The FATF had previously found Turkish sectors like banking and property vulnerable to illicit financing of groups like the Islamic State and al-Qaeda.

item.title: Biden debate flop leads Democrats to call for new nominee — but replacing him is tough to do
item.description: President Joe Biden emerged bruised from his first presidential debate with Donald Trump, raising fears about his age and ability to serve another term.

item.title: Nike CEO John Donahoe comes under fire as stock sees worst day on record
item.description: Nike's CEO John Donahoe has helmed the sneaker giant for nearly five years, but under his watch, its stock has underperformed and its lost market share.

item.title: Amazon is doubling value of credits for some startups to build on AWS as Microsoft cloud gains ground
item.description: With Microsoft's artificial intelligence technology drawing in more entrepreneurs to its cloud, Amazon wants to ensure that founders keep building on AWS.

item.title: Amazon beefs up AI development, hiring execs from startup Adept and licensing its technology
item.description: As part of the deal, Amazon will license technology from Adept including some of its AI models and datasets.

item.title: JPMorgan and Morgan Stanley boost buybacks and dividends, while Citigroup and BofA take smaller steps
item.description: The big banks announced their plans to boost capital return to shareholders after passing the annual stress test administered by the Federal Reserve this week.

item.title: Key Fed measure shows inflation rose 2.6% in May from a year ago, as expected
item.description: The core personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to increase 0.1% in May and 2.6% from a year ago.

item.title: France's election has the ability to rock wider European stocks, Citi strategist says
item.description: The stock market has not priced in a far-right or far-left majority, according to Citi.

item.title: Here are the 10 most livable cities in the world—Europe dominates the list
item.description: Vienna, Copenhagen and Zurich topped the list for the most livable cities in the world, according to EIU's 2024 Global Liveability Index.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The humble onion could be holding India's economy hostage
item.description: Even a modest change in the price of the bulbous vegetable soon becomes the talking point around dinner tables for hundreds of millions of people in the country.

item.title: Warren Buffett gives away another $5.3 billion, says his children will manage his estate
item.description: Warren Buffett on Friday made his biggest annual donation to date, giving $5.3 billion worth of Berkshire Hathaway shares to five charities.

item.title: DJT shares close down nearly 11% after Biden stumble in Trump presidential debate
item.description: Some Democrats said President Joe Biden needs to exit the White House race against Donald Trump after his debate performance. DJT stock may benefit.

item.title: 'Biden stumbles, Trump lies': How the global media reacted to the presidential debate
item.description: President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump went head-to-head in their first debate — and the world's media was watching.

item.title: Fed and European Central Bank could cut interest rates in September, Morgan Stanley strategist says
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve and European Central Bank could move to cut rates in September, a Morgan Stanley strategist said Friday.

item.title: France's far right looks headed for victory in the first round at the polls. Here's what that means
item.description: With just days to go until France's snap parliamentary election kicks off, victory for the far right looks increasingly likely in the first phase of the two-stage runoff.

item.title: Apple's Vision Pro starts deliveries at a higher price in China than in the U.S.
item.description: Apple's mixed-reality headset began deliveries in China on Friday with a retail price 18% higher than in the U.S.

item.title: Top Democratic fundraisers sound the alarm after Biden's debate performance
item.description: President Joe Biden's top fundraisers are sounding the alarm on his disappointing debate performance.

item.title: Specter of Putin casts a shadow over the Trump-Biden debate
item.description: Russian leader Vladimir Putin was invoked roughly a dozen times in the 90-minute debate between President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump.

item.title: 'Alarmingly high': E.coli levels discovered in River Thames ahead of famous regatta
item.description: Harmful E.coli bacteria has been discovered in the U.K.'s River Thames just days before elite rowers are due to compete for the international Henley Regatta.

item.title: SoftBank shares rise on $1.86 billion debt offering as CEO talks up 'super' AI
item.description: Softbank, which has a huge technology investment arm called the Vision Fund, has suggested it is looking to ramp up investments in artificial intelligence.

item.title: European stocks close lower after U.S. inflation data; UK GDP revised higher
item.description: European stocks moved lower Friday as investors digest key inflation data from the euro zone.

item.title: India's major bond market milestone could prove to be a double-edged sword for investors
item.description: Anticipating the Wall Street bank's decision, markets have partly pushed up bond prices this year despite risks of inflation reigniting.

item.title: Japanese yen weakens to fresh 38-year lows; top currency diplomat replaced
item.description: Separately, Japan has also reportedly replaced top currency diplomat Masato Kanda.

item.title: Younger generations of Asians are spending big on art
item.description: More than 40% of Sotheby's contemporary art buyers in Asia are millennials. While the size of the global art market fell last year, sales in China were up 9%.

item.title: India set to see billions in inflows as government bonds debut on JPMorgan's debt index
item.description: While the inclusion of the bonds into the JPMorgan index has been priced in already, PGIM sees a positive longer-term impact.

item.title: Forget to-do lists. Here are 4 tips on how to stop procrastinating
item.description: In a world that is increasingly distractible, learning how to harness our attention is the "skill of the century," says best-selling author Nir Eyal.

item.title: China is testing the limits of a critical U.S.-Philippines defense pact — will Washington respond?
item.description: China has stepped up its actions against the Philippines in disputed waters of the South China Sea, raising questions of American deterrence in the region.

item.title: Chinese smartphone maker Honor says AI's power is 'worthless' without data privacy
item.description: The transforming power of artificial intelligence is of no value unless user data is protected, says the CEO of Chinese smartphone company Honor, George Zhao.

item.title: Nike shares plunge after retailer says quarterly sales will fall 10%, warns on China weakness
item.description: Nike has found itself in a rough patch as the sneaker giant has worked to claw back market share it's ceded to upstarts like On Running and Hoka.

item.title: Onboard forests, street markets and reefs: Disney releases details about its new cruise in Singapore
item.description: The Disney Adventure will sail three- and four-night voyages from Singapore starting in 2025, with the capacity to carry some 6,700 passengers on board.
